Finding and Pitching Brands in 2025

Micro-influencers (1K–50K followers) are highly sought after in 2025, with 70% of brands seeking their authentic engagement for campaigns worth $100–$2,000. This guide shares six strategies to find and pitch brands effectively, with Newcollab streamlining the process.

Start Pitching

Why Pitching Brands Matters

Proactive pitching increases deal success by 50%, offering:

  • Direct Connections: Build relationships with brands.
  • Custom Deals: Negotiate terms that fit your style.
  • Visibility: Stand out in a competitive market.

Newcollab simplifies pitching.

1. Identify Micro-Influencer-Friendly Brands

Find brands

  • Research: Check Instagram for brands posting #ad with micro-influencers.
  • Target Niches: Focus on beauty, fitness, or lifestyle brands.
  • Use Platforms: Explore marketplaces like Newcollab.

‘Newcollab helped me find a $500 deal with a fitness brand!’

- Ethan R., Fitness Creator

2. Create a Compelling Media Kit

Showcase your value.

  • Include Metrics: Engagement rate (e.g., 5%), follower count, demographics.
  • Add Samples: Top posts or Reels.
  • Design: Use Canva for a professional PDF.

Newcollab offers media kit templates.

3. Craft a Personalized Pitch

Make an impact.

  • Personalize: Mention the brand’s recent campaign.
  • Highlight Value: Share engagement stats and audience fit.
  • Propose Ideas: Suggest a Reel or Story concept.

Use Newcollab’s pitch tools.

4. Choose the Right Channel

Contact brands effectively.

  • Email: Ideal for formal pitches with media kits.
  • Instagram DMs: Use for quick intros, followed by email.
  • Platforms: Apply via Newcollab for curated campaigns.

Pitch through Newcollab.

5. Follow Up Strategically

Persistence pays off.

  • Wait 5–7 Days: Send a polite reminder.
  • Reiterate Fit: Restate your value.
  • Stay Professional: Limit to two follow-ups.

Newcollab tracks pitch responses.

6. Negotiate Smartly

Secure fair deals.

  • Know Your Worth: $10–$50 per 1K followers for micro-influencers.
  • Clarify Deliverables: Agree on post types and deadlines.
  • Be Flexible: Offer extras for long-term partnerships.

Avoiding Pitching Pitfalls

Common mistakes:

  • Generic Emails: Tailor every pitch.
  • Missing Metrics: Include engagement data.
  • Overcontacting: Respect brand timelines.
